Key Arguments: The legislation exempts government communication from being considered misinformation or disinformation, which is seen as undemocratic and hypocritical.
The bill is perceived as a violation of free speech and an attempt to silence dissent against the government.
There is skepticism about the government's intentions, suggesting that the bill is a means to protect government interests and cover up mistakes.
The submission argues that the government has been dishonest, particularly in relation to COVID-19 and public health information.
The author believes that the legislation will not ensure government transparency or honesty.
Main Themes: Historical references to suppression of truth (e.g., Galileo)
Concerns about government overreach and control
Notable Quotes: This is nothing more than a TRAMPLING ON OUR RIGHTS.
How ridiculously gullible do you think we are that we believe this legislation is for our benefit?
If the Government were telling us the truth, people wouldn't bother to look elsewhere.
It's the MSM & Government mis/disinformation we want protection from â€” not a few opinionated people who release information that anyone can research & find out if it fits their truth.
